cves.credit: Noah Roskin-Frazee (ZeroClicks.ai Lab) and James Duffy (mangoSecure)

advisories.available: Mac Studio (2022 and later), iMac (2019 and later), Mac Pro (2019 and later), Mac mini (2018 and later), MacBook Air (2018 and later), MacBook Pro (2018 and later), and iMac Pro (2017)
advisories.impact: An app may be able to bypass Privacy preferences
advisories.description: The issue was addressed with improved permissions logic.

cves.credit: Ron Masas of BreakPoint.sh and an anonymous researcher

advisories.available: Mac Studio (2022 and later), iMac (2019 and later), Mac Pro (2019 and later), Mac mini (2018 and later), MacBook Air (2018 and later), MacBook Pro (2018 and later), and iMac Pro (2017)
advisories.impact: An app may be able to gain root privileges
advisories.description: The issue was addressed with improved checks.

advisories.impact: An app may be able to read arbitrary files
advisories.description: This issue was addressed with improved validation of symlinks.

advisories.impact: An app may bypass Gatekeeper checks
advisories.description: The issue was addressed with improved checks.

advisories.impact: A Wi-Fi password may not be deleted when activating a Mac in macOS Recovery
advisories.description: This issue was addressed through improved state management.

advisories.impact: An app may be able to access user-sensitive data
advisories.description: The issue was addressed with improved checks.

cves.credit: Arsenii Kostromin (0x3c3e), Joshua Jewett (@JoshJewett33), and Csaba Fitzl (@theevilbit) of Offensive Security

advisories.impact: Processing web content may lead to arbitrary code execution
advisories.description: A use-after-free issue was addressed with improved memory management.

advisories.impact: Processing web content may lead to arbitrary code execution
advisories.description: The issue was addressed with improved memory handling.

advisories.available: Mac Studio (2022 and later), iMac (2019 and later), Mac Pro (2019 and later), Mac mini (2018 and later), MacBook Air (2018 and later), MacBook Pro (2018 and later), and iMac Pro (2017)
advisories.impact: Processing web content may lead to arbitrary code execution. Apple is aware of a report that this issue may have been actively exploited against versions of iOS before iOS 16.7.
advisories.description: The issue was addressed with improved checks.

cves.credit: Bill Marczak of The Citizen Lab at The University of Toronto's Munk School and Maddie Stone of Google's Threat Analysis Group

advisories.available: Mac Studio (2022 and later), iMac (2019 and later), Mac Pro (2019 and later), Mac mini (2018 and later), MacBook Air (2018 and later), MacBook Pro (2018 and later), and iMac Pro (2017)
advisories.impact: A user's password may be read aloud by VoiceOver
advisories.description: This issue was addressed with improved redaction of sensitive information.

advisories.available: Mac Studio (2022 and later), iMac (2019 and later), Mac Pro (2019 and later), Mac mini (2018 and later), MacBook Air (2018 and later), MacBook Pro (2018 and later), and iMac Pro (2017)
advisories.impact: A remote attacker may be able to view leaked DNS queries with Private Relay turned on
advisories.description: This issue was addressed by removing the vulnerable code.

advisories.available: Mac Studio (2022 and later), iMac (2019 and later), Mac Pro (2019 and later), Mac mini (2018 and later), MacBook Air (2018 and later), MacBook Pro (2018 and later), and iMac Pro (2017)
advisories.impact: Processing web content may lead to arbitrary code execution
advisories.description: A correctness issue was addressed with improved checks.

advisories.available: Mac Studio (2022 and later), iMac (2019 and later), Mac Pro (2019 and later), Mac mini (2018 and later), MacBook Air (2018 and later), MacBook Pro (2018 and later), and iMac Pro (2017)
advisories.impact: An app may be able to cause unexpected system termination or write kernel memory
advisories.description: A memory corruption issue was addressed by removing the vulnerable code.

advisories.impact: An app may be able to unexpectedly leak a user's credentials from secure text fields
advisories.description: An authentication issue was addressed with improved state management.

cves.credit: An anonymous researcher, Jeremy Legendre of MacEnhance, and Felix Kratz

advisories.available: Mac Studio (2022 and later), iMac (2019 and later), Mac Pro (2019 and later), Mac mini (2018 and later), MacBook Air (2018 and later), MacBook Pro (2018 and later), and iMac Pro (2017)
advisories.impact: An app may be able to modify protected parts of the file system
advisories.description: A race condition was addressed with improved locking.
